topic.title: How to Change Number Styles for Ordered Lists

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p:
Ordered lists (ol) are usually numbered in XHTML output using numerals. If you want to change the numbering to alphabetical, follow these steps: Define a custom outputclass value and set it as an attribute of the ordered list, as in the following example:
  1. A
  2. B
  3. C
Add the following code snippet in a custom CSS file:ol.number-alpha{ list-style-type:lower-alpha; } Set the html.stylesheet parameter to the path of your custom CSS file Set the html.stylesheet parameter to the path of your custom CSS file Run the transformation scenarioscript.
